paper_abstract: Researchers studying the inter-domain routing system typically rely on models to fill in the gaps created by the lack of information about the business relationships and routing policies used by individual autonomous systems. To shed light on this unknown information, we asked 100 network operators about their routing policies, billing models, and thoughts on routing security. This short paper reports the survey's results and discusses their implications.
paper_title: A Survey of Interdomain Routing Policies
